data.title: Add oramod file association for Windows, Linux, and OSX.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: This makes it possible to double-click-run an oramod file.  Builds on the support added in #11771.

data.title: Make naval transports chronoshiftable
data.body:
I don't see a reason why they should not be chronoshiftable.
(It felt more like a bug/oversight, as we allow all other transport/naval units to chronoshift.)

Fixes #8503.

data.title: Remove duplication from TS civilian structure sequences.
data.body: This uses sequence inheritance to remove most of the duplication from the static map props (buildings, trees, etc), and also sets up the new depth metadata on these things in preparation for turning on the depth buffer.

data.title: Setup.exe installer is vulnerable
data.body:
The version shipped on Travis CI is too old. See http://nsis.sourceforge.net/Docs/AppendixF.html#v2.51
and https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nsis/+bug/1591708 for the "upstream" report. AppVeyor Windows CI is already updated in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11436 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11657, but not used to ship the actual installers.

data.title: Fix line rendering with depth buffer enabled.
data.body:
This, together with #11862,  implement the final engine changes (that I'm aware of) to support the depth buffer in the gen2 mods.  The remaining changes should be limited to the mod yaml – setting correct offsets and ramps to stop actors from clipping below the terrain.

Closes #7520.

To simplify testing my [depthbuffer-part-two](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/depthbuffer-part-two) branch merges this with #11862 and includes a commit that enables the depth buffer in TS.  There should be no visible changes in the classic mods.

data.title: Restore graphical look of the TS Ion Cannon.
data.body:
I defined the ion ring as the main effect of the weapon because that way it appears in the center of the targetted cell, and in order to make the beam I had to code it as many explosion effects, using many instances of it while also using the offset tag on the sequence. 
![ioncannonpolish](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11763228/17867954/88d4bb80-687a-11e6-991f-b8cdd2829d6e.gif)

see here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YnJlb-Zorz8 0:40.

data.title: Draw tactical overlays (beacons, rallypoints, text overlays, order generators) above the shroud.
data.body:
These things can be thought of like scribbles on top of a video feed, so drawing them behind the shroud doesn't make a lot of sense – it leads to inconsistencies in the classic mods, and downright bogus rendering in the heightmap-enabled mods when we turn on the z-buffer (the overlays can clip behind the terrain as shown in the screenshot below).
- Fixes #6106.
- Makes render circles / selection boxes from order generators render above the shroud like they do everywhere else (I don't think we have a ticket for this issue).
- Works towards #7520.
- Removes duplication/hacks from the health bar rendering.
- Fixes some code style issues.

![line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/17865728/8b3a639a-689b-11e6-95ae-509702ba37ca.png)

data.title: Using CrateSpawner's parachuting-crates option in isometric mods leads to the crate falling until reaching ground level instead of the terrain's actual height.
data.body: Might be with regular paradrops too,l haven't checked that yet.

data.title: Restart button for replay
data.body:
Ideally, would be perfect to be able to play in reverse (rewind a certain portion) the replay ^^

But maybe for a first step : having a "restart" button for replays ?

data.title: Let engineers detect mines
data.body: The minor part of #11749. The ability to defuse mines will be added in a follow-up PR.

data.title: Yaml style clean-up
data.body: It annoys me that these come up whenever I apply upgrade rules, I think it's time to actually adress them on bleed.

data.title: Tiedied up d2k building build menu icon order
data.body: Supersedes #11687.

data.title: Add support for sending messages to certain teams or players with lua
data.body:
This extends the normal `DisplayMessage` to include a team parameter (0 means to everyone).
And secondly adds a new method for sending private messages which accepts a player parameter.

data.title: Fixed a typo in the message displayed when servers disabled single player matches
data.body:
As reported by @jaZzKCS in Mumble.

``` diff
-"This server requires at least two human players to start match."
+"This server requires at least two human players to start a match."
```

data.title: Remove and document slope-specific tiberium artwork.
data.body:
http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=549033 explains that tib13-20 are used for slopes, and this can be easily confirmed by checking the shapes with the asset browser.

This PR removes these tiles from the Variants list so that they aren't drawn on flat tiles (which gives gappy looking fields).  It also adds some comments for the future when we decide to add ramp support for resources.

data.title: Multiply hitpoints and damage by factor 10 in D2k and 100 in other mods
data.body:
This should pretty much fix all rounding issues with damage percentages, versus values etc.

Closes #11719.
Fixes #11850.
Properly fixes #11425 (the TD Jeep + Buggy were still affected).

_Note:_ This _will_ somewhat affect balancing, as several weapons' damage versus specific armor types won't be rounded down nearly as much as before, in some cases increasing effective damage by as much as 50% against these armor types (effective damage of some RA/TD miniguns vs. Heavy goes up from 1 to 150 compared to pre-#11460 bleed, for example).

At least a certain amount of testing will have to go into this PR.

data.title: feature request: productionspeedmultipler trait
data.body: This is another one that's related to RA2, a soviet building the industrial plant, uses this but it can be applied for other uses too.

data.title: (Bleed) RA/TD Minigunners damage vs Heavy Armor fix threatens balance.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
#11460 doubles minigunners' damage vs heavy armor in order to retain damage output against veteran heavy armor. In effect, heavy armor melts in the prescense of infantry blobs making tanks less relevant as infantry support and the whole range of heavy armor units is effectively nerfed.

The issue came out of riflemen/minigunners doing 0 damage vs veteran heavy armor. #11425

data.title: Refactor warhead ImpactTypes
data.body: We currently have too many of them, some make hardcoded assumptions, some use the soon-to-be-deprecated `IsWater` check, and most ignore `TargetTypes` completely.

data.title: Multiple spy infiltration bonus
data.body:
I was thinking that, while playing RA with Alliance, the player often send a spy inside a building, or to shutdown the power grid, getting veteran units etc. (even if I still don't have understand what happend, when you send a spy inside a radar dome). If you try to send someone on the deployed MCV, you can't access it. After the player have sent a spy inside the enemy building, he doesn't need to use the unit more again (at least, for OpenRA, where you can use it for tactical kills). My idea was instead to keep the interest on player, on infiltrating enemy bases, adding a scalar system. For example, if you send a spy on enemy barracks, the first time, you get veteran units. If you send him again, you get the possibility to build one new enemy unit, that usually could be obtained only constructing the enemy barrack, after taken over the enemy MCV.

In short, spy infiltration (I throw just some ideas about how it could be):

Enemy barracks: (1) Get veteran units, (2) Get Granade launcher soldier, (3) Get Flamethrower soldier, (4) Get Hijacker, (5) Get Shock Trooper, (6) Get Attack Dog ....
Enemy warfactory: (1) Get veteran units, (2) Get APC unit (for example), (3) Get V2 Rockets... or even (4) Get Chrono Tank, (5) Get Demotruck ...
Enemy MCV: (1) Get Flame Tower, (2) Get Airplane strip, (3) Get Subpen, (4) Get French fake structures ...
Enemy Research Center: (1, Among with Radar Dome infiltrated) Get Spy plane, (2, Among with Radar Dome infiltrated) Get  Paratrooper, (3, Among with Radar Dome infiltrated), Get Parabombs, Get Counterstrike B-52 Air-Fuel bomber
Enemy Airstrip: (1) Get vetera units, (2) (After you infiltrated a research center and obtained an enemy airstrip for infiltration) Counterstrike Nuclear Mig

So you can even, using this kind of concept, introduce the hidden/secret counterstrike/aftermath units, like nuclear mig, fuel-air bomber, volkov, chitzkoi, even "strange" units from Paradox equation mission or various tipes of Giant Ants.

data.title: 'Cancel' in Content download dialogue possibly broken

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: I noticed this on #11841, when trying to download the Firestorm assets (which failed due to lack of mirrors), only the 'Retry' button worked, the 'Cancel' button did nothing.

data.title: Fix desert tileset tiling issues in RA

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This is what it looks like on bleed:
![screenshot from 2016-08-20 12 42 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/17830765/c5985294-66d5-11e6-8a6f-79812e0d308a.png)

The template that's displayed there is template 80 (both on last release and on bleed). However, compared to last release, the templates 79 and 80 appear to have been swapped. Somehow `falls1.des` and `falls2.des` must have been mixed up when the desert tileset was added to RA.

In TD, `falls1.des` is 3x3 cells and `falls2.des` is 3x2 cells as well, so that fits, [see here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/cnc/tilesets/desert.yaml#L1567-L1593).

The first commit fixes this, and restores the situation from last release.

This is what it used to look like:
![screenshot from 2016-08-20 12 43 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/17830767/d6ca16ce-66d5-11e6-9975-4f99ab58a7c5.png)

Notice however that that's actually a tiling error, the template is cut off on the right side (the bush on the lower bank is cut in half). The left part is template 80, the cave thing itself is template 76.

I corrected the tiling error like this:
![screenshot from 2016-08-20 13 02 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/17830783/6f277bc8-66d6-11e6-9930-8337f8648964.png)

Fixes #11829.

data.title: Added the Nod Cyborg Reaper
data.body:
Depends on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11787 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11624 as well as something that fixes 

```
 Actor has multiple traits of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Render.RenderSprites
```

for webguy to work.
